newsitem.title: FRANCE: France says ready to wait if no deal on NATO.
newsitem.headline: France says ready to wait if no deal on NATO.

text.p: France said on Tuesday that any lack of agreement on the dispute over U.S. command of NATO forces in southern Europe would mean reform of the alliance, which France is warming towards, was not complete.
But Defence Minister Charles Millon said that France would not halt its move back into the military wing of a reformed NATO alliance 31 years after it pulled out.
If no solution was found, France would wait. "We have time, we will wait, but there is no question of France ignoring the problem," Millon told a lunch of the Foreign Press Association.

"The solution is very simple. We wish that the European defence identity be confirmed, and one way for it to be recognised is through the chain of command. If no solution is found, that means that NATO reform is not yet achieved."
Asked whether this meant that France would freeze its move closer to NATO's integrated military command, Millon answered: "France will freeze nothing whatsoever."
France wants the post of NATO's Southern Command headquarters in Naples to be turned over by Washington to a European officer. The United States has refused.
France has tied the issue to its decision on whether to re-join the military wing of a reformed NATO alliance.
